title: Ider-Ider
text: Ider-ider is Balinese woven decoration cloth, which was first handmade back in 16-19 Century. Ider-ider is usually placed to be hung under the eaves of a pavillion in a palace or domestic temple 'pura' and 'bale gede' during ceremonies. The story is normally presented in a series of scenes running from left to right.
